programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack subs for the chef at Angelino's restaurant, where a mobster is so impressed with the bill of fare that he insists Jack be made permanent chef.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley's going to be in trouble if Helen finds out he's lost her new puppy "Muffin" on a walk. He decides that a look-alike just might fool her and get him off the hook. Will Stanley get away with it or be barked at by Helen?

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The clock Stanley gives Helen for their anniversary turns out to be stolen from Brookes' apartment.

programme.title: The Ropers

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack thinks Vicky is pregnant, but it's E.Z.'s dog who is expecting.

programme.desc: Business and politics don't mix well when Mr. Wainwright and Henry campaign for opposing candidates in the State Legislature election.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry's harping on how great Muriel's friend looks after a facelift drives Muriel to the rink of having one herself.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe falls in love with Yvonne, the Rush's new Latin housekeeper. When they decide to marry, Henry suspects Yvonne is only interested in gaining citizenship.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry goes to great lengths to avoid paying five years worth of late charges on some overdue library books.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry and Muriel develop problems of their own while playing referee to Marsha and Herb's marriage woes.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Against Iris' wishes, Henry submits a design for the interworld Travel Association's logo.

programme.sub-title: The British are Coming, The British are Coming

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry, Muriel and Andrew move to Marin County. Henry changes professions, Muriel hires a new housekeeper and makes Henry hire Monroe.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: The staff start gossip about Marlene and Christian who apparently went home together after an office party.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister is in competition with another store manager for the Vice-President position at Cobb's.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: When slow construction starts bringing Cobb's business down, Bannister has to decide two employees to lay off.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Feeling neglected by Howard, Edna hires an actor to play her 'secret lover'

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.sub-title: Buddy Can You Spare a Job?
programme.desc: Bannister decided to hire his old friend as the store's new butcher. Before long, the new hire is offending everyone in sight, and Bannister has to decide to fire him or not.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Jeffrey Brookes has a secret. His Uncle Bill is a free spirited "hobo" who has no interest in material things. To his horror, Bill shows up at his doorstep...but not before Stanley meets him and hires Bill to help around his place.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: A fire in the kitchen leads to the Ropers having to stay with the Brookes family until their place is ready again. However, Stanley's behavior gets on Jeffrey's last nerve.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: One of Cobb's favorite customers is Mr. Dale, an old vaudeville comic. When Mr. Dale reveals his retirement home will close unless money is raised, Bannister gives him a job at Cobb's.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Ben's cousin's daughter Abi is invited to dinner. Nick becomes a magician.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Abi wants to make a documentary of a "normal married couple", and there's a rat in the walls.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Janey calls home from university in crisis. Ben and Susan have a romantic adventure.

programme.title: My Family
programme.sub-title: The Second Greatest Story Ever Told
programme.desc: The Harpers experience competitive family strife over an amateur nativity play. Michael has girl difficulties. Ben has a toothache.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Michael is invited into a girl's room. Ben and Susan find a joint.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan visits Janey at University. Michael wants to go to Greece. Nick has a new job.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan wants to go away for her and Ben's wedding anniversary. Nick wins a car in a poker game. Michael finds some underwear.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: It's Ben's birthday, and Janey comes for a visit with a friend.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley is jealous when Helen wants to reunite with an old boyfriend who is in town, so he tries to reconnect with an old girlfriend to get even with her. Also, David trades Jeffrey's model train set for Stanley's old inner tube.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen and her sisters are shocked by their elderly mother wanting to have a 'wake' for herself. She invites others to say goodbye in advance. Also, Jeffrey throws his back out and is trapped in a chair.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The Brookes are expecting a Congressman to drop by and Jeffrey doesn't want the Ropers around when he comes.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley's physical checkup for a life insurance policy has him convinced his days are numbered.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Mrs. Roper thinks her husband is having an affair when she finds his hidden stash of love letters , written to a woman named Doris.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's mother comes for a visit. But later it is revealed that she has no place to go. So Helen and her two sisters get together to decide what to do, cause none of them really want her living with them.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's luncheon makes her consider leaving the Cheviot Hills neighborhood. Stanley believes her and, without asking, has Jeffrey Brookes put their home on the market. Will The Ropers really relocate?

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: A man shows up and claims to be Stanley's son. Stanley admits to know his mother, but doesn't remember the night that she claimed to conceive her son. Roper goes to talk to a friend who was with him at the time to find out if the claims are true.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen adores the Brookes' boy, David, which leads her to feel she and Stanley could adopt a baby. Stanley is against it. Still, she calls an agency and sets up a home interview.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack's chance to join an ocean cruise as assistant chef cooks up sizzling comedy when Janet and Chrissy fight to see who'll join him.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Ralph Furley tries to impress his childhood rival by introducing Chrissy as his new bride.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: A letter to a lovelorn column convinces Chrissy and Janet that the other is having a love affair with Jack.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack, Janet, and Chrissy face having to split up when Chrissy's father, Reverend Snow, announces that their special living arrangement jeopardizes his appointment as the new local minister.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack and Chrissy hatch an outrageous scheme to transform sensible Janet into a high-powered bombshell in order to cool off the amorous advances of Larry.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Chrissy and Janet's efforts to get Jack into prime physical condition succeed beyond their wildest expectations when their voluptuous gym instructor falls for him.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack faces eviction from the apartment when he inadvertently reveals to Furley his great passion for the opposite sex.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: When an absent-minded policeman leaves his handcuffs at the trio's apartment, Chrissy and Jack playfully slap the cuffs on each other and then discover there's no key.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: When Janet develops a sudden interest in having a baby, Jack and Chrissy hold some hilarious interviews with the men who they think have answered her advertisement for a father-for-hire.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack Tripper finally meets his match when a devilish 12-year-old boy wins the girl's sympathy and moves into the apartment.
